title: WeWork fiasco should put investors on guard against conventional companies masquerading as tech disruptors
text:
A friend of a friend started a new job over the summer after being out of work for a year. In fact, he started two. He had been interviewed by a number of companies, was offered a job and accepted it.

But, as can happen in these situations, soon after he was offered another role at a second – far more exciting – company. So he jumped ship. The second company was WeWork.

This morning he will have woken up to find his new employer has been taken over by SoftBank, its main investor. This means that SoftBank has invested more than $10bn (£7.75m) in a company that it is now valued at $8bn (as well as lending it $5bn more). That’s some seriously ugly maths.

The deal will further sideline Adam Neumann,...
description: A friend of a friend started a new job over the summer after being out of work for a year.
